page.title: 06EDUCATION, SEAMILL
page.content: {Seamill}is too{small}to have its own school so all{primary school children age four and a half to twelve years have to{attend}the primary school in {West Kilbride.}When children get past primary school age they have to get the bus at one of the stops and travel to one of three secondary schools. One is in Largs and two are in Ardrossan which is five miles away. They are Ardrossan Academy and St. Andrews Academy. { The primary school has more children {starting each year.}Separate class numbers have been getting bigger. It has generally been decided that each class should have a limit of thirty three pupils but there are sometimes more. As the numbers of new comers increase each year it is possible that Seamill may get a school of its own.
